greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Column 1 of triangle A107862; a(n) = C( n*(n+1)/2 + n, n).
link: R. Mestrovic, Wolstenholme's theorem: Its Generalizations and Extensions in the last hundred and fifty years (1862-2011), arXiv:1111.3057 [math.NT], 2011.
formula: Put b(n) = a(n-1). We have the supercongruences:
b(p) == 1 ( mod p^3 ) for prime p >= 5 (uses Mestrovic, equation 35);
b(2*p) == 2*p ( mod p^4 ) for prime p >= 5 (uses Mestrovic, equation 44 and the von Staudt-Clausen theorem).
3*b(4*p) == -4*p ( mod p^3 ) for all prime p. Cf. A135860 and A135861. (End)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 04 2005
